name: Tim Duncan
description: 6'11" power forward, the Big Fundamental. 5 championships, 2 MVPs, 3 Finals MVPs with San Antonio. Emotionless demeanor, fundamental excellence, quiet leadership. Bank shot specialist, elite post defender, played D&D.

bank-shot.name: Bank Shot
bank-shot.description: The signature glass kiss - perfect fundamentals
bank-shot.expression: calm focus, already knows it's going in
bank-shot.prompt: releasing perfect bank shot off the glass - arm extended with textbook follow-through, slight arc, eyes tracking ball to the square on the backboard, body balanced and controlled, the shot every coach teaches

post-defense.name: Fundamental Post Defense
post-defense.description: Perfect defensive positioning in the post
post-defense.prompt: in fundamental defensive stance guarding the post - knees bent, arms wide, positioned perfectly between man and basket, patient and immovable, forcing opponent into worst possible shot

stone-face.name: Stone Face
stone-face.description: No emotion after a big play - trademark blank expression
stone-face.prompt: standing with completely blank expression after huge play - no celebration, no emotion, same face whether up 20 or down 20, the ultimate poker face, teammates celebrating while he walks back stoically

championship-stoic.name: Stoic Champion
championship-stoic.description: Winning the championship without excessive celebration
championship-stoic.prompt: holding championship trophy with quiet satisfaction - slight smile but no over-the-top celebration, teammates going wild around him while he simply appreciates the moment, humble champion

fundamental-footwork.name: Textbook Post Move
fundamental-footwork.description: Perfect footwork in the post - drop step or up-and-under
fundamental-footwork.prompt: executing textbook post move - perfect footwork, shoulder into defender, ball protected, pivot foot planted, every movement efficient and practiced ten thousand times, fundamental mastery

high-five-teammates.name: Quiet Team Leader
high-five-teammates.prompt: giving simple high-five or fist bump to teammate - no elaborate handshakes, just quiet acknowledgment, leading by example not words, the teammate everyone wants
